Reviews.Title: “Huge Room but dated and a poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: sarahNorwich86
Reviews.Content: The room was large, three beds in mine for a single room booking, and clean with a powerful shower. However the breakfast wasn't great, just white toast, cornflakes and bad coffee. Staff on reception weren't particularly helpful on checking in and you have to leave your key at reception when you check out but when you asked for your key back they didn't question you or ask your name, so it didn't seem the most secure. But it is a good location for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but poor service/amenities”
Reviews.Author: Davo_NZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights and chose it because of price/location. Location was really good and we walked via Hyde Park to the city. The rooms were very hot and we had to cool the room by opening the window. Breakfast was very poor and not worth having. The front desk said they had WiFi but refused me access because I had an iPad and he said the wifi didn't work with Apple !!!! So my assessment of service is poor as I had to use the free wifi at the great cafe around the corner. No lift was a surprise and they should put this on the site.

Reviews.Title: “Worth of money with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Matias66
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in two twins, which were pretty small, but adequate enough. This small hotel is only 300 metres from Paddington Station, and many buses (e.g. 23) travel right via Sussex Gardens opposite the hotel. The very basic breakfast consisted of flakes, boiled egg, cheese, ham & watery juice. The coffee and toasts are served to the tables. Our rooms were clean, and so was the tiny bathroom with shower. The friendly manned reception is open 24h.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: sam9887
Reviews.Content: I was ripped off by Expedia as one of their 'hidden hotels' the only explanation being that the reviews are shocking on here and by doing this the hotel could hide its identity. I paid more under a cheapest possible rate than the hotel would charge me too. I booked this as a 3* hotel. When i pointed this out they said they were infact and unstarred B&B as they 'didnt belive in the star system.' The staff were rude, aggressive and indifferent. I was verbally assauted at breakfast when i pointed out they were advertising a Full English Breakfast, where as infact there was a selection of spam, cold boiled eggs, off cheese and toast if you were lucky. It got to a point where I called teh police for my own saftey as an elderly member of staff who may have been anything from the chef/owner/cleaner depending on who you spoke too was totally out of control. The room was small, damp, unclean, TV did not work. Just avoid this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: john n
Reviews.Content: This place is horrendous. Terrible, disrespectful service. It's close to Paddington Station, but you should only consider this place if you think the proximity outweighs the blatant racism you're going to experience from the staff. I have an African friend they wouldn't let into the hotel. I was absolutely livid but got no response from anyone. STAY AWAY AT ALL COSTS!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: veronicamorali
Reviews.Content: If you stay 2-3 nights, it's a good hotel but no more. It has the basics and it's clean. The beds are neat though I suggest taking off the first two covers. The bathroom is fairly small but usable. Only thing is that there is no lift so it's hard to take the luggage up/down. I would suggest going to a small cafe that's only a block away for a good breakfast (omelette, toast, english breakfast, etc.). Outdated.

Reviews.Title: “never EVER stay at this hotel. unless you feel like being RIPPED OFF!”
Reviews.Author: Sam D
Reviews.Content: i'm not going to state every detail of how horrible this hotel is but i will say to anyone, NEVER EVER stay at this hotel. they tried to scam me by charging more to my credit card, tried to charge me twice, i called my credit card company from their phone line to make sure it didn't go through twice and they tried to charge me 15 pounds for the phone call. i by accident left a bag of belongings in the room when i left including $280 worth of clothing, $28 of electronics, an airplane pillow and vodka and they said they "threw it out". i called back several times a day and finally a week later they said they found the $28 electronic but not the rest of the belongings. oh and they want me to pay the shipping fees to ship it back. the employees are rude, degrading and could care LESS about customer service. i was lied to and yelled at more times than i could count. when i asked to speak to a manager, i was told by one employee that they would be back september 15th, i called the next day and they said the manager would be in tomorrow, the manager never called. so i had to call long distance YET AGAIN. i want to make sure NO ONE stays at this hotel and receives the HORRIBLE service that i did. it's caused waaay too much stress in my life. i would give this hotel -100 stars. or maybe -$500 for how much they owe me. be sure to pass this on and tell anyone who's going to england to never EVER stay here

Reviews.Title: “we'll NOT be back”
Reviews.Author: Maurizio M
Reviews.Content: The hotel is of very bad quality. Breakfast is not a breakfast. The only advantate relies on the proximity of the Paddington station.

Reviews.Title: “Did not honor reservation”
Reviews.Author: GJM3
Reviews.Content: Booked through an agent. Received a conformation email and code from the Orchard. Upon arrival, the clerk told us there was no room for us. When I showed him the confirmation code, he responded with a shrug of total indifference. I asked him to put us in another hotel nearby (we had chosen this one for its proximity to Paddington Station.) He offered to book us in a hotel in the City (the financial district), 3 miles away, but refused to pay for a taxi or even phone one for us - he told us we could take the subway. Unacceptable. At this point we called the travel agent and they got us swiftly into another hotel nearby - lesson learned - AVOID the Orchard.

Reviews.Title: “poor cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: warren3449
Reviews.Content: noisy no power points in the room very scruffy old style tv with 3 channels breakfast shocking its not much better than a hostel for the homeless i recomend staying anywhere in sussex gardens than this so called hotel. and the staff have very poor attitude

Reviews.Title: “What we paid for”
Reviews.Author: Bevin M
Reviews.Content: Recently traveled to London, and stayed at the Orchard Hotel. Based on several reviews I read before going, it was exactly what we expected. Three of us stayed in a room and the size was fine. The bathroom was very small and there is no counter space, which is obviously a problem for three women. However, the room was clean and the water was hot. We didn't expect much more than that and spent very minimal time in the room. The location is right near Paddington station which is a main Railroad hub and stop on the underground. After the first day we were very familiar with the underground and never had trouble finding out hotel at the end of the day. There are a lot of bars and restaurants near by, but they close up pretty early (before midnight). The staff was friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: redlizard11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was pretty basic. But as I am a twenty-something year-old traveling with friends, it was fine. We booked a triple and the room was a decent size--one bed was even a double. There was someone at the desk 24 hours a day which was nice. However, there are no visitors allowed and that's a rule you can't really get around.

Reviews.Title: “OK, if you want the basics”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugsPerth
Reviews.Content: A very small hotel, very basic, clean but the bed mattress were not very comfortable. The bathroom was tiny which is not unusual, but recently renovated. It was a bit noisy from other guests coming and going. Breakfast was basic. The location is good to the train station and restaurants. If you want nothing flash this hotel is for you. The staff are not that helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back”
Reviews.Author: IainDM
Reviews.Content: I guess going by some of the reviews on here, people had a lot bigger expectations that what I have for London Hotels. If you want air con, lifts and all the mod cons go to the big named hotels that will happily separate you from lots f your money for each night you stay. A lot of the hotels in London are like the Orchard Hotel - historic four or five story terrace houses that have been converted into a hotel. This is the best one of those we have stayed in so far. Stayed with my wife and two young children in a Quad room - one double and two standard single beds. The room was very large - the biggest in the hotel. TV had multiple channels - only thing missing is a channel listing and it would take for ever to surf thru the channels to find what the kiddies wanted. There is no air conditioning, or fans, so on a hot summers night it can be warm in the rooms - guess it depends on what you are used to as to whether that is a problem. There is breakfast, but never made it. Timing for this was strange - finished at 8:30am. But if you walk out the hotel, turn left and take the second road on the left - you will find plenty of little cafes that do a wonderful breakfast. Wireless Internet is available at 10 pound a night or 30 pound for 7 days. Lobby staff - wouldn't say they filled me with enthusiasm, but they where willing to help, when help was required. All in all, a good staging point for London tours at a reasonable price for a family of four and we will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “rooming house”
Reviews.Author: greatpetie
Reviews.Content: This is not a hotel.Its a rooming house.Musty smell.Stuffy hot corriders.There was no lift so i had to carry 3 bags up to the third floor.Now im in pretty good shape but i dont exercise in dress pants and shirt and tie. I would not eat breakfast there if they paid me to. Had to wait at least 15minutes before any hot water was available and even then the water pressure was low.The water went all over the washroom floor due to no tub for water to drain.Tv had 3 channels. No kleenex.Just a sad reason for a hotel.Stay away.The front desk guys were there solely to collect your passport and give u the key.No other reason for them to be there.Completely useless.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Swedentraveller93
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel in the price range! Nicley decorated rooms though small not a very "big" problem.. A decent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & very good value”
Reviews.Author: Musicista
Reviews.Content: 5 minutes to Paddington or Edgware Rd tube stops, this no-frills hotel was a wonderful home base. Breakfast adequate. Rooms cleaned/bed made daily; front desk staff friendly & helpful. Good eating on London St a block away: Mimo's Cafe's full English breakfast; Ya Hala (Lebanese) & Mughal (Indian). Travel tips: Oyster Card (tube) & LondonWalks

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value, comfortable room and lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Peetimu
Reviews.Content: We had very low expectations based on other peoples' reviews but the Orchard proved to be a real treat! The room was tastefully decorated, comfortable and warm and had a nice little flat screen TV. It is a stone's throw from Paddington Station one side and Edgware Road the other so it was so easy to get everywhere and the staff were wonderful. The lovely man at reception not only gave us a charming wake-up call ("good morning" rather than the usual "this is your wake up call" that I have had at other hotels) but was kind enough to help me with printing an urgent document on a Sunday morning when all the internet cafes in the area were closed. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Small, Clean, Ok for a trip to London!”
Reviews.Author: WISALSU
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is set in a row of hotels up and down the street. They all are attached so remember yours!!! You get just the basics which is a bar of soap and towels and 2 glass drinking glasses.The location was fine for someone who had no idea what to expect in London. We easily walked the 3 blocks to the Tube Station and from there you can get anywhere. A few places to eat in this area too. I did have the English Breakfast.....blah... it was something to put in your stomach as you started your day of sightseeing. I guess that makes it a nice touch. Our room was downstairs even though the number was 501? I thought that would make it five stories up! By the way the stairs were a nightmare with luggage! Twisting and STEEP going down... can't recall a banister either!! The view was from in a window well type set up. No view at all! The curtain had to be drawn or the visitors on the first floor could look right into your room/bed. I would recommend this hotel but just be aware that it isn't anything but the basics. When we asked about securing our luggage after we checked out we were shown a room just off the front that easily would allow anyone to wheel away our bags. So forget that option! Unfortunately the bags came with us to the Palace and to the Tower of London....what a pain that was!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Heidi9330
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I arrived in the middle of the night, as our plane was delayed from Denmark. We just had to ring the doorbell and the receptionist opened straight away. He was polite and we got a room for 2 with 2 single beds. The room was small, but looked newly renovated. The bathroom was nice and there was plenty of hot water. There was soap and we had new towels twice in our 4 nights stay. There is also hairdryer and tv in the room. The breakfast is simple, but get you going for a couple of hours. The location is great. 12 min walk to Madame Tussauds and 15 min walk to Oxford street. 30 min walk to Harrods. Very central. It is not luxery, but do you want a cheap and clean hotel I will recommend The Orchard.

Reviews.Title: “Dont even bother”
Reviews.Author: H0liday_Queen_10
Reviews.Content: Staff were extremley rude and not helpful!!! Rooms were horrible. Breakfast was a joke, lined up for 25 mins as they dont have enough tables for the amount of guest and then was offered "cornflakes OR english?" in those exact words, no hello or good morning just rude staff her werent afraid to yell if you didnt respond straight away. The english breakfast wouldnt fill up a 3 year old and the orange juice tasted like bleach and you were only aloud to have one small glass. The hotel manager is a very demeaning and rude lady i have no idea how she managed to get the job considering she has NO customer service skills.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate at the price.”
Reviews.Author: Loz97
Reviews.Content: Trying to find a hotel in London to a reasonable standard and at a reasonable price is a soul destroying task. When I looked, even all the major budget chains wanted well over £100 per night. After reading the reviews on this site, and a long trawl of the internet, I alighted on the Orchard. There appears to be a huge variation in price on the various sites, so try several, I paid £60 for a single room. The hotel seems clean and well kept. The welcome at reception was warm enough, with everything explained clearly. The room was actually a very small double, perfectly serviceable for what I wanted, a shower when I arrived and a night’s sleep. Beware, it is minimalist with little room to walk around the bed, and would be awkward if you had a lot of luggage. The shower room was clean and newly refurbished, with plenty of hot water. No frills, no shampoo, no tea and coffee, not even a shelf for your toothbrush. Bed was comfy and the bed linen clean, not always the case at this price range I believe. A good point on a sweltering night, the room faced the back, and the window opened fully. Sussex Gardens is a pleasant street, lined with small hotels. It is a very short stroll to Edgware Road with its interesting mix of ethnic restaurants and shops. There is a very acceptable pub almost opposite, but beware it closes at 11 pm, rare these days in the UK. Paddington Station is very close, and Marylebone not much further. I was away before breakfast, so can’t comment, but if other reviewers are right, then I didn’t miss much. Off for breakfast in the first class on the Wrexham and Shropshire train from Marylebone...........but that’s another story.

Reviews.Title: “Didnt expect much. Didnt get much”
Reviews.Author: herbie_gump84
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nites in June. 200Euro for 3 nites in london i wasnt going to turn it down. I read the reviews before I left so was prepared (and avoided breakfast - we ate at Nina's Cafe, Nice!). When we arrived the guy at reception was nice and welcoming, we were sent to room 101. Nice sized room, double bed and 1 single and an 'ensuite' sized bathroom. all seemed fine. When we left we had to always hand in our key, one older lady whom i suspect was the mother of this family was always shouting, when she was at reception she was like a demon. When I returned to the hotel and asked for my key i was always given a grilling by this lady before she handed back my key, not a nice person. Anyway the walls were like paper, there was a loud noise at certain times each nite... it was like a generator or something? We were there during the Heat Wave, the windows did not open so it was impossible to stay in the rooms. BUT location wise this place is perfect, close to restaurants, bars and the tube. And the price was Perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Anna1983Turku
Reviews.Content: The hotel was small and super simple. Rooms were small and bathroom even smaller. There were only two towels and one soap, nothing else. No minibar, no safety box, no mugs or glasses and no air conditioning. We had one single bed and separated from that one wider one (which was too small for the both of us to sleep on). There were no quilts, only blankets with pictures of teddy bears (cute, but not in a hotel!). And "the breakfast" was the worst ever! I had a continental breakfast which meant that I was brought a small cup of cereals. Nothing else. My husband had an English breakfast which consisted of one egg, few beans and one strip of bacon. We also got two toasts. After this horrible morning, we went to a nearby internet cafe and booked ourselves a room from another hotel. When we went back to check out, the staff was very rude and insisted that we should pay for our entire 5 nights reservation although we stayed only one night! We had cancelled our reservation via internet just before, but they claimed that because we used an internet company they have nothing to do with that and we'd have to pay for the hole time. After a long debate we ended up paying for two nights 170 € + the cancellation fee 85 €. Luckily the next hotel was way better and we could enjoy the rest of our stay in London.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, value for money - excellent staff and service”
Reviews.Author: manfromstaffs
Reviews.Content: Thank you Orchard Hotel - Fab breakfast served with speed and a smile. 24 hour reception, free parking and warm radiators. Yes it is simple - very simple! Tiny bathroom and no kettle in the room. However, we paid peanuts and got basic facilites - its all we required to be honest as the location is tip top and you'd be stupid to stay in the hotel! I'll never search again now I've found this hotel, we'll be using it the next time we stay in London!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, clean, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MerseysideJane
Reviews.Content: My daughter needed to be at the American embassy at 08.15 the following morning so we needed somewhere to stay that was within walking distance because we didn't fancy the tube at rush hour. This location was ideal. We walked there from Victoria coach station and checked in early evening. I liked the fact that there is 24hour reception and the reception staff were polite and helpful. I had booked and paid in advance through hotels4U. The nearest places to eat are on Edgeware Rd. The majority are Lebanese but we ate in a lovely Italian. Our twin room had a double and a single bed. We faced the front so there was some traffic noise but this did not bother us. The blackout curtain was effective. The en suite was clean and the shower was really powerful and hot. Soap and towels were provided. There were no coffee making facilities which I would have liked to see. Breakfast was fine, served from 7.30, limited choice - english or cornflakesand toast with juice and coffee or tea but adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay”
Reviews.Author: katysha
Reviews.Content: The location is very good. The hotel was ok, the room was very fresh and clean,... but it was located on 4th floor and there was no elevator at hotel!!! So we had to carry our bags ourselves and stairs was small and steep, the good thing was a soft capret along the stairs...if you fall... But it was ok, good training :))

Reviews.Title: “Great location, horrible staff”
Reviews.Author: a2555233
Reviews.Content: Location near by Paddington station is good. Rooms were good. Staff was very rude and non-professionla. Breakfast room was horrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “NICE 3 * HOTEL - GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: ROULA-THANOS
Reviews.Content: After our horrible experience at the West Point hotel we had to find a room for 4 days shortly before New year. Luckily enough we found a room at the Orchard hotel. Although it was the only alternative it proved to be a very good selection. The rooms/ WC have been renovated/redecorated lately with new furniture's, LCD TV and satellite TV,. . Rooms were clean and at least the rooms we were given being a triple was big enough for a couple. The hotel has an ideal location close to the train station of Paddington station and tube. Staff was helpful at all times. The only negative I could thing is that there is no elevator and the breakfast served being English Breakfast does not give a lot of choice expect of Eggs, Bacon and Bean. We do recommend this hotel as an economic choice in an ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Gina007
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband for a 2 night stay last week and after readng previous review was not a bit worried about what we'd find but upon arrival to this hotel after just 5 minute walk from Paddington I was pleasantly surprised, the staff were nice enough and our room (101) was a bit old fashioned but the bathroom looked new and the whole room was spotless, The main reason I'm putting this review in here was to tell you how honest the staff here are, I left 3 expensive items of clothing hanging in the wardrobe and I didn't even realize for a week, when I rang the hotel they had kept them for me and were only to glad to arrange to post the clothes to me at home. They didn't have a number for my as I booked through Lastminute.com and we're not in the phone book, I was so pleased to have my clothes returned it just goes to show you that there are still plenty of honest people left in this country, Thank you Orchard Hotel, we wil return.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms & low level of service”
Reviews.Author: BlommanFlower
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in a very small room, 2 people has to take turns in walking by the beds and the door to the shower room had to be open to be able to wash the face! Cleaning consisted only of making the beds, towels or bed linen were not changed during our stay for 4 nights! There was a daily line-up situation to get seats for the mediocre breakfast, consisting of a choice between cornflakes or English breakfast. Location however, was great, only 2 blocks from Paddington Station/Heathrow Express, Metro and buses.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay there!”
Reviews.Author: Doglover73
Reviews.Content: It was a really terrible hotel! Cheeky staff, no elevator and a room that was just terrible! Hard pillows, weird blanket on the bed and a breakfast not worth the word! Tv.... well lets just say no remote and U could hardly look at any prgms. Was it worth the money, not a chance!!

Reviews.Title: “No complaints for the money paid”
Reviews.Author: CCM01
Reviews.Content: Given the money we paid for 3 night B&B I have to say I wasn't expecting much. I was pleasantly surprised though, the room was a reasonable size for 2 and the hotel was clean throughout which to me is the most important thing. The location is very good with Oxford Street, Hyde Park etc within walking distance as well as Tube Stations nearby and buses which stopped right outside. The staff didn't say much but were pleasant enough. Breakfast was basic, 1 rasher of bacon, 1 egg etc but again, could hardly complain for the money paid.

Reviews.Title: “cold and old fashioned”
Reviews.Author: RED71hull
Reviews.Content: the hotel looks very classy from the front but thats about it ...my friend and I were in a twin room on the 2nd floor -the layout is very confusing with the breakfast room being located down lots of winding stairs which is very unsuitable for elderly or disabled ...the room itself was at the back of the hotel so not much noise from the busy life at the front ...the bedding was very old fashioned with horrid patterned bedspreads with 1970s fleece pink and blue blankets under those, the sheets seemed clean thou and not that old...as it was november it was cold and the window -well it was sooo draughty even thou it was closed the cold air was blowing in..the radiator was under the window and i had to bunch the curtains up as they were hanging over the radiator blocking the litle heat that was coming from it.....the bathroom was grotty, smelt of damp and had a peeling ceiling and the hot water even thou i ran it for ages , was just very luke warm so i couldnt even get a shower ...no coffee or tea making facility ....and the small tv had some sort of interference so was crackling and making funny noises.... so really our night away was just ruined by a very poor hotel ..and i was glad to get back home.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but small room”
Reviews.Author: VisitorEastYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, our room was small but ok just for a couple of nights. There are no tea/coffee making facilities so take your own travel kettle etc. if you want a drink. The receptionist was friendly, but the staff serving breakfast were obviously not happy in their work and breakfast itself was adequate if you are watching the calories (eg one rasher of bacon, one egg and beans). We had to ask three times for butter for our toast and it seemed to cause an argument between the staff. Like a previous reviewer we left our towels on the floor to be changed, but they were just picked up and placed back on the rail to dry. The location is fine, with plenty of eateries around the corner and 5 mins walk from Paddington. If all you want is a clean hotel with no extras at all then its ok.

Reviews.Title: “Fine location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Occasional_Journey
Reviews.Content: The location on Sussex Gardens was great. Easy access to Paddington Station, Paddington tube station, #15 bus line. Several pubs and restaurants nearby, and a 24-hour food store. Walking distance of Hyde Park, Kensington Palace, Royal Albert Hall (in daytime). Our room for three adults was small but adequate. Beds were clean and comfortable, with extra pillows in the wardrobe, Our room, at the top of several flights of narrow stairs (no lift) was very quiet... no traffic noise at all. Bathroom was small (of course) with no shelf space to set things out, but that was not a major issue. Breakfast (fried egg, baked beans, bacon, toast, coffee, tea, orange juice) was tasty and filling, and the kitchen staff was friendly and responsive. TV in our room had a limited selection of channels, but the programs we did watch were interesting and informative... the equivalent of PBS in the US. I would be glad to stay again at the Orchard Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK for budget hotel but won't return”
Reviews.Author: abeh762
Reviews.Content: As a budget traveller I wasn't expecting much and therefore wasn't too disappointed. The room and bathroom were clean - small, but that is to be expected in London. The location was great (10 mins from Paddington station and about the same from Hyde Park - important as a runner!). The front desk staff were friendly enough, although the women serving breakfast were a bit rude (i.e., like they were "put out" if you asked them for something). The continental breakfast was disappointing - cornflakes, white bread toast, and something masquerading as "juice". Cereal and toast are fine, but something other than cornflakes and "Wonder Bread" would have been better. I had a curious issue with my towels - I left my wet towels drying on the rack when I left in the morning and found the same ones upon my return. I know some hotels indicate that if you'd like to reuse your towels you should hang them on the rack and if you'd like new ones you should put them bathroom floor. That hadn't been my intention, but reusing them was not a problem. The next morning I left the wet towels (day two) on the bathroom floor expecting to receive new ones. Upon my return I found the same towels drying on the rack - I expected that leaving them on the floor was a clear indication that I wanted clean towels. I had to ask the front staff for clean towels - a bit unusual - how many days did they expect me to reuse the towels??

Reviews.Title: “A bed and little else...”
Reviews.Author: affinity89
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel whilst attending a concert in Hyde Park. While we were satisfied with the distance between the Park and the hotel, we realised that the area was less than desirable. Upon entering reception we were greated by a less than welcoming gentleman, who seemed to find our mere presence a cause for complaint. Our room was at the front of the hotel, on the third floor, overlooking a block of flats and the main road. Although this did not appear to be an issue at first, it became more so later on as the road became quite busy during the night. Our room was surprisingly small, featuring two twin beds, a tiny bathroom lacking any toiletries or a plug for the sink. We had a very small television, although this was plugged into the only socket in the room. When we unplugged it to use our electrical items, we noticed that the television plug was frayed, which appeared slighly dangerous. There was no remote provided, some of the buttons on the front of the television did not work and the picture was intolerable. Another cause for concern was that the door did not feature any form of deadlock, or even a chain. When another guest entered the room opposite ours, resulting in their standing next to our door (the corridor was very narrow and dark) the door almost came open. As two young female travellers, this made us nervous to say the least. The final issue regarding the room was the window. It was a wooden sash, which in itself appeared quite pretty. However, we noticed when in bed that there was a constant breeze and the road noise was rather loud. There was a 3 inch gap between the upper and lower panes which could not be closed and hence had to be endured. Whilst the breeze was welcome during the warm temperatures, in winter I'd imagine this would become irritating. The breakfast room was located in the basement (four flights of stairs down from our room). Whilst we found a free table quickly (as we went into the breakfast room at 7.30am) those arriving slighly later had to wait. The 'full english breakfast' was beans, a rasher of bacon and a very 'well done' fried egg. On a positive note, we were given tea and coffee, toast, jam and butter to accompany the cooked breakfast and orange juice was available. All in all, I was a little shocked by the standard of the hotel and the fact that quite a few of the staff appeared to detest the inconvience of having guests, whilst they struggled to communicate with us due to poor English language abilities. That said, it was clean, the beds were quite comfortable and in relation to Hyde Park the location was okay. However, I do believe you could find better quality hotels for the same price should you look elsewher.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is extremely terrible!”
Reviews.Author: Renminbi
Reviews.Content: There is no internet, no kettle, no cups, no toothpaste, no toothbrush, no slippers, no shampoo, no soap... I paid over 100 Pounds per night for this. I feel the place is dirty. The receptionists are rude and impolite.The female manager is very rude too. Will never return to this hotel. This is the truth...

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Rosiemary
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the Orchard and found it fine. Location is great especially if you come in from Heathrow as Paddington is the station you arrive in and is two mins from hotel. Breakfast was fine- bacon, egg and beans each morning and sometimes sausage or rissoles. All quickly served and with ok coffee. Room was a good size and bathroom very clean. Good value for money but if I was in London again I would stay in a hotel in Sussex Gardens that had a bar so I could sit and relax in my hotel after a tiring day out.

Reviews.Title: “Central, Clean, Quiet, Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: bobbysilk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights whilst working in London and would be happy to recomend to anyone. Its clear that you dont get as much for your money in London with regards to hotel rooms. But if you want a hotel that provides a clean comfortable base to enjoy the city then stay here. I only had time for breakfast one morning and again it was fine. The hotel is three tube stops away from Kings cross, ten mins walk to Baker Street and only fifteen to Park lane.

Reviews.Title: “Ups and Downs!”
Reviews.Author: Gandalph
Reviews.Content: Positive points: Clean! Pretty Central. Warm. Negative points: There must be many more rooms than places for breakfast because we had to wait for a table 2 days out of 3. This would not be so bad except that there isn't really anywhere to wait! Breakfast itself is a choice of English or Continental. I chose English the first day and got 1bacon, 1 sausage, i fried egg and beans. The next day it was missing the sausage! When I pointed this out I was told that some days it includes a sausage and on others it doesn't!!! The Continental was cornflakes and toast!! Don't expect parking even though they advertise it! I think they have 2 spaces!

Reviews.Title: “First impressions”
Reviews.Author: LizzieBournemouth
Reviews.Content: As we arrived at the hotel I thought how nice it looked but my first impression of the room was oh how dark and gloomy and no outlook.. On further inspection the ceiling in the bathroom was in need of attention. However, after this I started to see the important things. The bedroom and bathroom was very clean, the sheets ironed beautifully and the room very warm. The staff at reception and in the breakfast room were friendly. Breakfast was English or continental included in the price (some hotels you pay a supplement for an English breakfast). Continental was cornflakes, toast and orange juice, not the sort of continental the 'Brits abroad' are used to but nevertheless both proved adequate . The location was also good. In life you only get what you pay for and I think this was good value for money and my husband and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: tricky22
Reviews.Content: this hotel was really better than expected. Been to London before and spent nights in various places, but in this hotel I could imagine spending a night again. It's close to many tube stations and easy to find, we booked it via venere.com and it was quite cheap. Because our trip lasted longer than planned, we had to make two bookings, but they understood it well and we were able to keep the same room for the whole stay. Although we booked a double room, we got a room for three for the same money and it was clean and nice. Of course there was noise from the street and a room was a bit chilly, but where wouldn't it be. Breakfast was nice, there was a lot to choose from and it was enough to get the day going. Would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Over expectations”
Reviews.Author: Hoborc
Reviews.Content: I can't say, that it was the best hotel in my life, but London is especialy expensive, therefor to find a hotel in a good location with en suite shower and toilet under Ł100/night for four people is not easy. The staff was polite and helpful, the breakfast was good. For budget travellers it is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Room, Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Theo58
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard for 8 days in May. Our room, at the front overlooking Sussex Gardens, had a double and a twin bed for the two of us which gave us extra room. The ensuite bathroom was small but clean with good shower pressure and lots of hot water. The room was great for the price, much cheaper than many nearby hotels. We were greeted warmly by the front office staff as we were returning for our second visit to this hotel. I found the front desk staff to be friendly and very courteous. They were most helpful getting me an iron and ironing board after I did the laundry at a nearby laundromat. There are a number of good pubs nearby, one just across the street, as well as a number of restaurants closer to Paddingington Station. There are also a number of grocery stores within easy walking distance. We will be returning to the Orchard hotel on our next trip to London as it is convenient to the tube, buses, (the #15 goes right from Paddington past Trafalgar Square right out to the Tower of London!!) shops, Heathrow Express, etc., etc.

Reviews.Title: “Worst client service”
Reviews.Author: MontrealPili
Reviews.Content: Worst client service I have ever had and I have travelled a lot. The manager said, and I quote, "we are not in the business of receiving your comments." She was paranoid and did not want us to speak another language in her lobby, she kept asking us what we were saying. The toilet was broken and we were offered no alternative. They would have the plumber out the next day. We had to ask if we could have access to another room, but were denied. We were 4 people in this room with no toilet. We were on the 4th floor with a very narrow staircase and no elevator. no alarm clock. Very rude and poor service at the breakfast room in the morning. Beakfast ends at 8:30am. Like the previous reviews: very simple, basic. Which is ok, but the rude service made it unbearable.

Reviews.Title: “Would not return even if the room was free!”
Reviews.Author: marie44_canada
Reviews.Content: If your use to service with a smile and consideration, don't expect anything like it at this hotel. Manager is very rude and the rest of the staff is clueless (couldn't check flight departure hour online, didn't know where to find an Internet cafe, etc.) Breakfast consisted of beans and eggs or corn flakes accompanied with toasts, coffee, and watery orange juice. No fruit is served. The room and the location is "ok" thought there is no pressure in the shower and the street is very noisy at night. If you have another alternative, I say pick the other one... it sure would be better.

Reviews.Title: “Basic and simple”
Reviews.Author: river.trout
Reviews.Content: I agree with the previous poster that the hotel is very simple. For me (travelling with wife and her father) the hotel was perfect. We booked a room with three beds, and were put in a room on the back side. The windows opened onto an inside area, and faced other rooms -- so no scenic views, but also no noise from the road. The room was clean, the bathroom was small but also clean. It was a bit spendy, but during my research I failed to find any other reasonable hotels in the Paddington area. So for a three person room in mid-June the price seemed OK. The kitchen staff were indeed Polish, and very friendly. After two weeks of croissants and coffee in Europe I welcomed beans, eggs, bacon, and tomatoes!

HotelInfo.Name: Orchard Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 86-90 Sussex Gardens, London W2 1UH, England
